title: Use inference to fill in missing type parameters

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code: <!-- Please provide a link to play.rust-lang.org -->

```rust
struct Wrapper<T>(T);

fn make_wrapper() -> Wrapper {
    Wrapper(())
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[[E0107]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/error-index.html#E0107): missing generics for struct `Wrapper`
 --> src/lib.rs:3:22
  |
3 | fn make_wrapper() -> Wrapper {
  |                      ^^^^^^^ expected 1 generic argument
  |
note: struct defined here, with 1 generic parameter: `T`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:8
  |
1 | struct Wrapper<T>(T);
  |        ^^^^^^^ -
help: add missing generic argument
  |
3 | fn make_wrapper() -> Wrapper<T> {
  |                      ~~~~~~~~~~

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0107`.
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
error[[E0107]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/error-index.html#E0107): missing generics for struct `Wrapper`
 --> src/lib.rs:3:22
  |
3 | fn make_wrapper() -> Wrapper {
  |                      ^^^^^^^ expected 1 generic argument
  |
note: struct defined here, with 1 generic parameter: `T`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:8
  |
1 | struct Wrapper<T>(T);
  |        ^^^^^^^ -
help: add missing generic argument
  |
3 | fn make_wrapper() -> Wrapper<()> {
  |                      ~~~~~~~~~~~

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0107`.
```

Possibly with a note explaining that the argument was inferred?

Rationale: This could reduce the number of compiler invocations in the case where the type checker is used to figure out the actual return type by not having to insert a bogus type parameter which is then type checked.
